result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney Lee Stroik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: - The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

* June 14, 2022/Judge Jeffrey Wagner: Court ordered a total of 68 days of sentence credit on counts one and two. *
Credit for 132 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: - No driving without a valid license.
- Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

supervisions.notes:
- The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
- Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

* June 14, 2022/Judge Jeffrey Wagner: Court ordered a total of 68 days of sentence credit on counts one and two. *
CONCURRENT WITH COUNT 1, with credit for 132 days time served.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 132 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 MONTHS.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 2: The Court ordered the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, CONCURRENT WITH COUNT 1, with credit for 132 days time served. 

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
No driving without a valid license. 

The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel. 

FILED: Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Defendant Rodney Lee Stroik in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Rodney Lee Stroik in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Jury Trial. First call. Defense submitted a counter to the state. Case passed. Case recalled. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND AMENDED COUNT 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Case proceeded to sentencing. 

e-FILED: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
AS TO COUNT 2: Court ordered charge amended to RESISTING AN OFFICER, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.41(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, filed.
